oai_dc:dc.dc:description: TO ABATE SMOKE IF FUEL SAVED Dads Favor It If Coal Is Saved. Mrs. French's Request For Action Taken Under Advisement. Whether or not the city commission will pass an ordinance requiring factories in the city to equip their standpipes with smoke consumers or their furnaces with smoke abaters, in compliance with the request of Mrs. L. C. French, representing an Ossoli circle committee, will depend on whether or not the smoke eliminators will save fuel for the companies. N. B. Kuhlman. commissioner of public safety, announced he would not vote on such an ordinance unless a saving was instituted by the consumers. It is understood tha[t] the other members of the commission agree with Commissioner Kuhlman on this point. Mrs. French, in addressing her request to the commission, stated the abaters would save fuel. The commission will send to other cities where smoke ordinances are in effect to secure copies of the measures and information regarding the efficiency of such a law. If the plan is found feasible, it is expected the commission will pass such an ordinance. A mass meeting of women will be held today in the Woman's building, under the auspices of the Constituional league, to discuss the smoke question from all angles and a further appeal may be made to the commission. It will probably be several weeks before the commission acts on the project.
